Content: 2*p65748a0216*answer all questions.1 a student made measurements to determine the density of the metal from which a coin was made.she was given 20identical coins and a set of verniercalipers.(a) (i) describe how she should accurately determine the diameter d of a coin.(2)(ii) the student estimated the thickness of a single coin to be approximately 2mm.  she measured the thickness of 20coins stacked together to determine the mean thickness of a single coin.explain why this would result in a better value for the thickness t of a single coin.(3)

3*p65748a0316*turn over    (b)the student measured d as 2.24cm and 20t as 5.76cm.(i) the mass m of 20 coins was measured as 190.4g. determine the density  of the metal of the coins ingcm3.(2) =  gcm3(ii) state why it is important that the percentage uncertainty in d is small.(1) (iii) the uncertainty in the measurement of d was 0.01cm and the uncertainty in the measurement of 20t was 0.03cm.  the uncertainty in the measurement of the mass was negligible. deduce whether the coins could be made from cupronickel, which has a density of 8.86gcm3.  you should include calculations in your answer.(4)(total for question 1 = 12 marks)

4*p65748a0416*2 the diameter of a single hair can be determined by shining a laser beam onto it.(a) state one safety precaution that should be observed when using a laser.(1)(b)when the laser is switched on, light diffracts from each side of the hair and acts as two coherent sources of light, separated by the width of the hair.  this produces an interference pattern on a screen.stand and clamp holding laser pointerstand and clamp holding peg with hairscreenexplain how positions of minimum intensity are formed on the screen.(2)

5*p65748a0516*turn over    (c) the diameter d of the hair can be determined from the formulad = dswhere  is the wavelength of the laser light, d is the distance from the hair to the screen and s is the distance between consecutive minima.explain the effect of doubling d on the percentage uncertainty ind.(3)(total for question 2 = 6 marks)

6*p65748a0616*3 the luminosity of a filament bulb depends on the power inputp to the filament bulb.  the radiation flux f received by a light sensor positioned a fixed distance away from the bulb can be taken as a measure of the luminosity of the filament bulb.it is suggested that the relationship between p and f is given byp = kf 4where k is a constant.(a) describe the measurements that should be made to test the relationship.(2)(b)draw a circuit diagram to show how the filament bulb should be connected.(2)
7*p65748a0716*turn over    (c) explain how the measurements will be used to test the validity of the relationship.(4)(total for question 3 = 8 marks)

8*p65748a0816*4 a student investigated how the resistance r of a thermistor varied with its temperature.the thermistor was placed in a beaker of hot water.  the beaker was allowed to cool.  the student measured r using an ohmmeter at different values of  measured with a thermometer.(a) state two techniques he should use to ensure that the measurement of  is as accurate as possible.(2)(b)the student obtained the following results. / cr / k800.625651.11501.95353.46206.11510.80013.1the relationship between r and  is given byr = r0ewhere r0 is the resistance of the thermistor at 0c and  is a constant.(i) plot a graph of ln r against  on the grid opposite.  use the additional column in the table to record your processed data.(5)
